msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US Circuit Courts, Western District of Washington, Seattle; Law Register Northern Division, 1899-1906, vol 2

div1.p: In the Circuit Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington
In the Matter of the Application of Columbia George for a Writ of Habeus Corpus
Filed in the U.S. Circuit Court Western Dist. of Washington FEB 24 1906 A. Reeves Ayres, Clerk P.M. Hapkins, Dep.
Service of Papers in this case may be made upon R.J. Slater Pendleton, Oregon Attorneys for Petiioner
In the Circuit Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington
In the Matter of the Application of Columbia George for a Writ of Habeas Corpus. No1390. Petition
To the Honorable Judges of the Circuit Court of the United States, for the Western District of the State of Washington

The petition of Columbia George respectfully shows: That Columbia George is unlawfully imprisoned, detained, confined and restrained of his liberty by CB Hopins, United States Marshall for the Western District of the State of Washington, at the Penitentiary of the United States, at McNeil's Island in the said District and State.
That the said imprisonment, detention and confinement and restraint are illegal, and that the illegality thereof consists in this, to-wit;

That on or about the 21st day of November, AD, 1901 the said Columbia George was indicted, tried and convicted in the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Oregon, of the crime of murder in the first degree, and by recommendation of the jury in ther verdict, he was by said Court sentenced to imprisonment for life, and under said conviction and sentence he was thereafter confined to the Oregon State Penitentiary at Salem, Oregon, and was thereafter by order of the Attorney General of the United States, transferred to the custody of CB Hopkins, said United States Marshall for the Western District of the State of Washington, and is now in his custody at the United States Penitentiary as above alleged

That said indictment and conviction were based upon the following facts, to-wit, that the said Columbia George is a full blood Indian, and that the person murdered was a full blood Indian, and the said rime was comitted upon the Umatilla Indian Reservation in the State of Oregon, and that the said Columbia George was a tribal Inidan belonging to the Cayuse band of Indians and resided upon said Reservaation, which facts it was claimed by the United States Court in and for the District of Oregon in said case, but the facts were, and the record in case shows:

That the said Columbia George is and was at the time said crime was committed a full blood Indian and was at said time an allottee of land in severalty upon said Reservation under an Act of Congres approved March 3rd, 1885, and had received from the United States Government a Trust Patent for said land, by reason of which facts he was at said time a citizen of the United Staes, and of the State of Oregon and entitled to all the rights, privileges and immunities thereof, and was subject to the laws of the State of Oregon, and the said Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Oregon by reason thereof had no jurisdiction in said matter.

Wherefore, Your petitioner prays that a Writ of Habeus Corpus may be granted, directed to the said C B Hopkins, commanding him to have the body of Columbia George before your Honors at a time and place therein to be specified, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered by your Honor concerning him, together with the time and cause of the detention of the said Columbia George, and said Writ; and that he may be restored to his liberty.
